titleStmt.title: The valiant hearted sea-man; declaring a late skirmish fought between our English fleet and the Dutch. Wherein the Dutch was worsted, two of the Dutch ships sunk, and two taken as lawful prize, with a very small loss on the English side. The tune is, Lusty Stukely.
titleStmt.author: J. R. fl. 1665.

notesStmt.note: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
